snippet: How can we claim the advantages of online education without losing the most essential triangular configuration — student, teacher and world — in higher education?
abstract: Op-Ed article by author Aaron Hirsh holds courses provided online by colleges and universities have certain advantages, like being more accessible, but are too focused on accreditation; contends traditional college courses prompt and equip students to investigate the world, leading to a more engaged life, in a way that online courses do not.
lead_paragraph: How can we claim the advantages of online education without losing the most essential triangular configuration — student, teacher and world — in higher education?
